status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Image tasks using no-upload option are going to canceled/failing preventing the task to be resumed and the image uploaded and task completed. 

{code}
ec2-import-volume ~/cirros/cirrosraw.img --w $EC2_SECRET_KEY -owner-akid $EC2_ACCESS_KEY -f raw -b mattimport -z PARTI00  --ignore-region-affinity -U $EC2_URL -v --no-upload
Setting User-Agent to [ec2-api-tools 1.6.12.2]
Requesting volume size: 1 GB

2014-04-10 17:16:26,887 [main] DEBUG org.apache.http.wire  - << "seType>"
ERROR: Task import-vol-5e846805 is not active task.

{code}
fields.summary: import tasks using no-upload are canceled/failed and can not be resumed

comments.body: Import tasks get a full week to complete.  The client need not upload the import manifest nor any disk image parts immediately after starting a task -- the service must wait for them to appear and not time the task out until that week has passed.
[~gholms] thanks. that explains it! It's an example of poor api design IMO (where message doesn't capture all intent).

Testing the latest code, I am still seeing this. In one case, the task was at first healthy, but eventually showed a volume (also a bug, tracked in EUCA-9123) and then was listed as failed:

{code}
# euca-import-volume /tmp/my-2GB-file --format raw --availability-zone PARTI00 --bucket mah-import-bukket-02 --o
wner-akid $EC2_ACCESS_KEY --owner-sak $EC2_SECRET_KEY --prefix pref-02 --description "mah second import with euca-import-volume, h
ow exciting" --no-upload
TaskType        IMPORTVOLUME    TaskId  import-vol-ac801dcc     ExpirationTime  Sun May 18 14:52:19 PDT 2014    Status  active
DISKIMAGE       DiskImageFormat RAW     DiskImageSize   2147483648      VolumeSize      2       AvailabilityZone        PARTI00 Ap
proximateBytesConverted 0
...
# euca-describe-conversion-tasks 
TaskType        IMPORTVOLUME    TaskId  import-vol-ac801dcc     ExpirationTime  Sun May 18 14:52:19 PDT 2014    Status  active
DISKIMAGE       DiskImageFormat RAW     DiskImageSize   2147483648      VolumeSize      2       AvailabilityZone        PARTI00 Ap
proximateBytesConverted 0
...
# euca-describe-conversion-tasks verbose
TaskType        IMPORTVOLUME    TaskId  import-vol-ac801dcc     ExpirationTime  Sun May 18 14:52:19 PDT 2014    Status  active  St
atusMessage     Creating volumes
DISKIMAGE       DiskImageFormat RAW     DiskImageSize   2147483648      VolumeId        vol-e365548f    VolumeSize      2       Av
ailabilityZone  PARTI00 ApproximateBytesConverted       0
....
# euca-describe-conversion-tasks verbose
TaskType        IMPORTVOLUME    TaskId  import-vol-ac801dcc     ExpirationTime  Sun May 18 14:52:19 PDT 2014    Status  cancelledS
tatusMessage    Import task failed unexpectedly
DISKIMAGE       DiskImageFormat RAW     DiskImageSize   2147483648      VolumeId        vol-e365548f    VolumeSize      2       Av
ailabilityZone  PARTI00 ApproximateBytesConverted       0
....
# euca-describe-volumes vol-e365548f
VOLUME  vol-e365548f    2               PARTI00 available       2014-05-11T21:53:03.294Z        standard
{code}

In another case, it apparently went through those steps faster, going straight to failed in a matter of seconds. Again, leaving an available volume behind.
[~dmitrii] I suspect that this might be the race condition. Do you have the java components distributed? Do you have the system that I can reproduce?
There was a regression. Fix is in testing.
Tasks can now be initiated with {{--no-upload}}. And resumed with {{euca-resume-import}}.

Not only that, but I interrupted {{euca-resume-import}} multiple times (with ^C) and it always picked up where it left off and the image that ended up in the volume had the right checksum! Good work, [~gholms] and [~spark]!
